results.adx_keywords: State Legislatures;United States Politics and Government;McMorrow, Mallory;Democratic Party;Michigan
results.title: A Michigan lawmaker who lashed out after being smeared as a groomer becomes a Democratic money machine.
results.abstract: In an interview, State Senator Mallory McMorrow said her aim was to help flip the Michigan State Senate, which Republicans have controlled since 1984.

media.caption: Michigan State Senator Mallory McMorrow has raised more than $1 million since a speech she gave in April went viral.

results.title: Why It Matters That J-Lo Is Now J-Aff
results.abstract: I like the romance of Bennifer 2.0 as much as the next person, but her name change makes me wince.

results.adx_keywords: Marburg Virus;Disease Rates;Bats;World Health Organization;Ghana
results.title: What to Know About the Marburg Virus Disease
results.abstract: Two people infected with the virus died in Ghana last month, though no other cases were found, experts said. The disease’s fatality rate is high.

media.caption: Researchers gathering bats in 2018 at Queen Elizabeth National Park in Uganda to study the animals’ role in transmission of the Marburg virus.
media.copyright: Photo by Bonnie Jo Mount/The Washington Post via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: United States Politics and Government;internal-sub-only-nl;Project Democracy;Presidential Election of 2020;Right-Wing Extremism and Alt-Right
results.byline: By Blake Hounshell and Nick Corasaniti
results.title: A Hidden New Threat to U.S. Elections
results.abstract: Some Republican-led counties are refusing to certify election results — a move that could throw American democracy into chaos if it becomes widespread.

media.caption: Election workers scanning ballots last month in Lancaster, Pa. The county and two others have refused to process certain absentee ballots, which has delayed the state’s certification of its primary results.

results.title: Colorado Man Pleads Guilty to Casting Missing Wife’s Ballot for Trump
results.abstract: Prosecutors in April dropped a first-degree murder charge against Barry Morphew, whose wife, Suzanne Morphew, disappeared in May 2020.

media.caption: Barry Morphew with his daughters after a court appearance in Cañon City, Colo., in April.

results.adx_keywords: Women and Girls;Retirement;Pensions and Retirement Plans;401(k), 403(b) and 457 Plans;Content Type: Service;Credit and Debt;Age, Chronological;Personal Finances;Financial Planners
results.title: When a Woman’s Retirement Account Becomes the Family Emergency Fund
results.abstract: Women break into their savings to cover all kinds of expenses: home down payments, repairs, medical bills. That can hurt them years later.

media.caption: Vickie Elisa tapped her Roth individual retirement account for home repairs and to help family. “I told myself, once I had built up a pretty good cash flow, I would start building it back up again,” she said.
media.copyright: Nicole Craine for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Vaccination and Immunization;Coronavirus Omicron Variant;Disease Rates;Biden, Joseph R Jr
results.title: Biden had received a second booster. Here’s why it wasn’t enough to prevent infection.
results.abstract: The Omicron variant is evolving in ways that make it better able to evade the body’s immune defenses. But booster shots still help prevent severe illness.

media.caption: President Biden received his second Covid-19 booster shot at the White House on March 30.

results.adx_keywords: Pregnancy and Childbirth;Abortion;Breast Cancer;Cancer;Drugs (Pharmaceuticals)
results.title: After Roe, Pregnant Women With Cancer Diagnoses May Face Wrenching Choices
results.abstract: Urgent questions arise about how care of pregnant women with cancer will change in states where women are unable to terminate pregnancies

media.caption: Half of cancers in pregnant women are breast cancer, but many others occur and complicate an already complex medical situation.

results.title: He Built a Home to Survive a Civil War. Tragedy Found Him Anyway.
results.abstract: C. Wesley Morgan once believed that the place he built, which included a 2,000-square-foot bunker, was the safest house in Kentucky.

results.adx_keywords: Renting and Leasing (Real Estate);Real Estate and Housing (Residential);United States Economy;Interest Rates
results.byline: By Conor Dougherty and Ben Casselman
results.title: We Need to Keep Building Houses, Even if No One Wants to Buy
results.abstract: Right now, builders have too many homes and not enough people to sell them to. In the long term, the United States has the opposite problem: Not enough houses for all the people who want them.

media.caption: “We’re going to look project by project and say which ones are we are going to go ahead on and which we are going to take a pause on,” said Randal Lewis of the Lewis Group of Companies, which is doing work in Chino, Calif.
media.copyright: Philip Cheung for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Endometriosis;Menstruation;Pain;Content Type: Service
results.title: A Debilitating Illness, Often Ignored
results.abstract: Nearly one in 10 women experiences the chronic pain of endometriosis, but for many the symptoms are dismissed. Why is this still happening?

results.byline: By Annie Karni and Maggie Haberman
results.title: In Jan. 6 Hearings, Gender Divide Has Been Strong Undercurrent
results.abstract: An investigation that has revealed grave threats to democracy, plotted and carried out mostly by men, has a heavily female cast of narrators who have paid a public price for speaking out.

media.caption: Matthew Pottinger, left, and Sarah Matthews at the Jan. 6 hearing on Thursday. Like other female witnesses, Ms. Matthews quickly came under attack for her appearance before the House committee.

results.title: Justice Dept. Will Investigate Environmental Racism in Houston
results.abstract: The inquiry, part of an administration-wide racial justice initiative, came amid claims that the city has ignored illegal dumping in Black and Latino areas.

media.caption: The investigation is likely to be one of the most ambitious environmental justice reviews undertaken by the Justice Department in recent years.

results.title: Baltimore Prosecutor Defeated in Democratic Primary Amid Legal Woes
results.abstract: Marilyn Mosby, who rose to national prominence for her handling of the death of Freddie Gray, was indicted in January on charges of perjury and financial misconduct.

results.title: Ethics Board Moves to Penalize Jeffrey Clark, Who Aided Trump in Election Plot
results.abstract: A D.C. Bar office filed a complaint against Jeffrey Clark, the former Justice Department official who worked to undo the results of the 2020 election.

media.caption: A Pride event in Michigan where Attorney General Dana Nessel spoke in June. “The dominoes have started to fall,” said Ms. Nessel, a Democrat who was the first openly gay person elected to statewide office.
